data.title: Birthday diner at the depot 🍺
data.text: Went to  the  Depot for dinner last night and I  must say it was excellent, food, service, atmosphere was all outstanding!

data.title: Nice atmosphere
data.text: The food was good but not for the prices especially how good the food is in Missoula in general. The only con was the entrance smelled weird but once you're inside it smelled good.

data.title: disappointing
data.text:
we asked in town and were directed to go here for 'good steak' ...we were just passing through and thought we'd find one somewhere here.  the service was good and rather than steak, we were told that they're known for their prime rib, so my husband chose that and i ordered a filet.  both cuts of meat were extremely disappointing - the prime rib was a huge chunk of beef, it looked like a roast and my husband said it had no flavor at all, even doubting it had been cut from anywhere near a rib.  my filet was fatty and also tasteless.  i doctored it up with a lot of salt and butter which made it edible.  

the baked potato was good, as was the caesar salad and creme brulee we ordered for dessert which was big enough for us to share.  these didn't make up for the sub-standard beef though.  sure thought we'd get better in montana!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Awesome service! Loved the choices on menu. We had small plate scallops, salmon and halibut. Was very good and could not finish it all:( great atmo

data.title: Perfect
data.text: Great place to take my son and his roommate for a birthday dinner.  Meals were all fantastic   Prime rib sirloin and depot kabob.  Calamari fries were a great starter too.

data.title: Best Steak in Missoula
data.text: Went here on a recommendation from a friend. Glad we did, one of the best steaks we have had in a long time. Nice service and average prices.

data.title: Deck Good. Restaurant Too Expensive.
data.text: This used to be one of my favorite spots 5 years ago before they priced themselves so high beyond other good places.  I realized that I good get prime rib and ribeyes of even better quality and much cheaper at some other steakhouses in town.  The restaurant is also cramped.  What I do enjoy though is the deck or lounge area.  The atmosphere is better.  My wife and I occasionally stop in here for appetizers and desserts. They do have great desserts.

data.title: Great fun evening
data.text: This is a brilliant place if you want good, local food in a buzzy, happy atmosphere. We're not local and not from the US but were welcomed as though we were part of what felt like a Depot family. We loved the fact that we could have the A La Carte menu on the Deck, where there was music, sport on a selection of screens and clearly a lot of locals having fun- and they were of all ages. Thanks for a great evening.

data.title: Great Spot for a Business Meeting
data.text: Oh my goodness was the service terrific and the food and drinks to match!  We were in Missoula on business and our group of around 12 people had its own dining room.  The two servers who took care of us absolutely spoiled us.  They were terrific.

data.title: Get a reservation for the restaurant
data.text: Our family was hoping to be seated in the restaurant, but being early for service, we were told we needed a reservation. Instead, we were seated in a perfectly nice booth in the bar area and were able to order from the restaurant menu. Good steaks were had by all though they were on the more expensive side. Our server was attentive and pleasant.

data.title: Best dinner we had in Missoula
data.text:
My husband and I had dinner at the Depot our first night in town and it set the bar high.  My husband is always ready for a good steak dinner and he was not disappointed; both of our cuts were terrific (I had the 6 oz flank steak, which can be tricky if not cooked correctly, but mine was tender and juicy) and cooked exactly as we had requested.  We also enjoyed our sides (fresh snap peas as the vegetable of the day, garlic mashed potatoes with shaved parmesan - yum!), and a great salad.  Prices were a little more expensive than we had expected but this was mostly for the bigger cuts of beef ($40 for a steak, even a big one, is a lot for me to pay) and our choices were affordable in the $22-26 range.

We thought we might be under-dressed in nice jeans and shirt/blouse, but we were fine even in the dining area.  Our server Mark was fantastic.

I said that this restaurant was appropriate for kids, but in saying that I'm thinking of well-behaved kids who can eat something other than chicken nuggets or cheeseburgers.  In my own family we didn't have that kind of kids until about age 14, but I know other families do a better job of this than we did.

data.title: Great stop
data.text:
Received a recommendation for this restaurant. Great service and good food. Sat on deck but ordered from dining room menu. Both of us had steak done to preference, very tender. The garlic mashed potatoes were excellent with shaved parmasan cheese . Had Loco coco sundae for dessert, incredibly delicious! Had Missoula cocktail very refreshing. 
Very pleasant atmosphere, very good food. Definitely a place to consider when in Missoula

data.title: Great Food and Beer!
data.text: After traveling half the day on Sunday, we were ready for a good dinner.  The hotel front-desk provided a handful of suggestions based on our criteria.  We decided to give the Depot a try.  This restaurant is located in the downtown area with easy access and parking.  The Depot has two sides that you can sit in either the restaurant or bar.  Both sides have plenty of seating.  We opted to sit in the bar area because we wanted a beer or two before dinner, plus I prefer eating in the bar area.  The place was about half full, which is about right for an early Sunday dinner.  The waitress was at our table within a couple of seconds after we sat down.  She brought over dinner menus and took our drink order. They have a large selection of beer and wine that should satisfy most individuals.  The menu has a wide selection of items to choose from so we had no problem finding something that would satisfy our taste buds.  We placed our food order plus a couple of appetizers.  As requested, the appetizers arrived within a few minutes, and they were very good.  The restaurant has a salad bar that is well stocked.  Our dinners arrived shortly after we finished our appetizers, which was great timing.  The food was prepared as requested.  The steaks were tender and juicy.  The entire meal was very good and flavorful.  The atmosphere in the bar area is relaxing and friendly.  When you are looking for a good meal and drinks at reasonable price, then I suggest you give the Depot a try when in Missoula.

data.title: Birthday dinner
data.text: Traveled to Missoula to celebrate my Brothers Birthday. We dined at The Depot. Food and staff were equally wonderful.

data.title: GOOD STOP FOR PRIME RIB
data.text: This is a great spot for prime rib. We always order a side if deep fried veggies too. Go early for a little quieter atmosphere. If you are on a budget or not wanting to gorge yourself order a double cut of prime and split it ( waiter will do that for you), There will be plenty, its a good way to go.

data.title: Meh
data.text: Peppered NY Strip could have used some A1...and I never use it. Rare not Med rare as ordered. Caesar salad dressing was pretty strong and drenched it.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: The Depot staff is top-notch and the food is out of this world. Their menus (dining and bar) have something for everyone. I have never had a bad time or poor service / quality at the Depot. I highly recommend this place.

data.title: Good restaurant
data.text: They have an extensive salad bar.  Our waitress was very friendly and accommodating of special requests.  I had the grilled salmon, and it was excellent. I would certainly go again.

data.title: Always a great dining experience!
data.text:
I have been dining at The Depot since 1981 when I moved to Missoula.  The first time I went there I met my future wife.  The reason for dinner at The Depot last night was to celebrate our 34th Wedding Anniversary.
The weather was so nice we decided to eat on the deck.  The atmosphere was great and the employees were fabulous.  Everyone of them greeted us as we entered and they really took great care of us.  Our waitress Jess was so friendly and attentive.
My wife had the chicken sandwich and I had the Sloppy Jose sandwich.  Both were delicious.  We also had the shrimp wonton appetizers.
They gave us free mud pie for desert and it was to die for.
Thank you for 35 years of great food and service.

data.title: Sea bass
data.text: Here after the saturday meet. Had the Chilean Sea Bass with ginger wasabi glaze. It was buttery but a little fishy. The Pepper Bridge cab was quite good. The pilaf was ok but they forgot my roasted asparagus. Service was pleasant but their first cab recommendation was off the mark. We were in the wine room downstairs so after a busy day at the pool, the peace and quiet was very nice. Likely back again the next time down.
